Package model

Class Car

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • model.Car
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class Car
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Represents a car in the game. Manages all information about the car and its driver.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Car.Color
      Used to describe the color of the car.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.lang.String aiName
      The name of the AI controlling this car if there is one.
      private Car.Color color
      The color of the car.
      private int[] coordinates
      The coordinates at which is the car currently located.
      private int crashCountdown
      Stores the value of how many turn has the car to wait before continuing the race because it has crashed.
      private boolean crashed
      Is true if the car has crashed and has to skip turns as punishment.
      private DriverAI driver
      The AI controlling the car if there is one.
      private boolean finished
      Is true if the car has finished the race.
      private Game game
      The game of which is the car component.
      private java.lang.String playerName
      The name of the player controlling this car.
      private boolean sunk
      Is true if the car has sunk into water and is no longer able to continue the race.
      private static int TURNS_SKIPPED_ON_CRASH
      How many turns are to be skipped as punishment for crashing into a wall (or the side of the map).
      private int[] velocity
      The vector representing the current velocity of the car.

      void accelerate​(int[] a)
      Changes the velocity vector of the car by adding the acceleration vector given as parameter.

      Decreases crashCountdown by one and sets the car to "not crashed" if the countdown is finished.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Car

        public Car​(java.lang.String playerName,
           java.lang.String aiName,
           Car.Color color,
           DriverAI driver,
           Game game)
        The Car class constructor. Initializes the attributes of the car.
        Parameters:
        playerName - the name of the player whose this car is.
        aiName - the name of the AI driving this car. (NULL if human is driving the car.)
        color - the color of the car.
        driver - the instance of the compiled AI which will be driving this car.
        game - instance of Game to which the car will be added.
        See Also:
        DriverAI

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Determines which texture should the car use and paints the car. Also paints the numbers representing the waiting time (in turns) after the car crashed.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g -

      • setCoordinates

        public void setCoordinates​(int x,
                           int y)
        Sets the coordinates of the car to the given values.
        Parameters:
        x - the value to which is the X coordinate of the car to be set.
        y - the value to which is the Y coordinate of the car to be set.

      • setCoordinates

        public void setCoordinates​(int[] coordinates)
        Sets the coordinates of the car to the given values.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - the values to which are the coordinates of the car to be set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the length of the int[] given as the parameter is not 2.

      • accelerate

        public void accelerate​(int[] a)
        Changes the velocity vector of the car by adding the acceleration vector given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        a - the acceleration vector which is to be added to the velocity vector of the car.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the length of the int[] given as parameter is not 2 or the values of the int[] are not -1,0 or 1.

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity​(int[] velocity)
        Sets the velocity vector of the car to the given values.
        Parameters:
        velocity - the values to which is the velocity vector of the car to be set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the length of the int[] given as the parameter is not 2.
